lead_paragraph: Warships in the Mediterranean Sea fired cruise missiles days after Russia began bombing runs from a base in Iran.

byline.contributor: Andrew E. Kramer reported from Moscow, and Anne Barnard from Beirut, Lebanon. Michael D. Shear contributed reporting from Washington.
byline.original: By ANDREW E. KRAMER and ANNE BARNARD

headline.print_headline: Russia Asserts Its Military Might in Syria
headline.main: Russia Asserts Its Military Might in Syria

snippet: Warships in the Mediterranean Sea fired cruise missiles days after Russia began bombing runs from a base in Iran....
abstract: Russia, for first time, launches cruise missiles at Syrian targets from warships in the Mediterranean Sea; attack, following bombing runs from Iranian base, forms demonstration of might and ability of Russia to strike region from virtually all directions; United States responds by scrambling aircraft to protect its allies from Syrian government airstrikes.
